case_vignette:
a 24-year-old man comes to the emergency department because of progressive shortness of breath and intermittent cough with blood-tinged sputum for the past 10 days. during this time, he had three episodes of blood in his urine. six years ago, he was diagnosed with latent tuberculosis after a positive routine tuberculin skin test, and he was treated accordingly. his maternal aunt has systemic lupus erythematosus. the patient does not take any medications. his temperature is 37°c (98.6°f), pulse is 92/min, respirations are 28/min, and blood pressure is 152/90 mm hg. diffuse crackles are heard at both lung bases. laboratory studies show:
serum
urea nitrogen 32 mg/dl
creatinine 3.5 mg/dl
urine
protein 2+
blood 3+
rbc casts numerous
wbc casts negative
a chest x-ray shows patchy, pulmonary infiltrates bilaterally. a renal biopsy in this patient shows linear deposits of igg along the glomerular basement membrane.
question: which  is the most likely diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Renal and Genitourinary System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been experiencing progressive shortness of breath and an intermittent cough that sometimes has blood in the sputum. Additionally, I've noticed blood in my urine a few times over the past 10 days.
Do you have any swelling in your legs or around your eyes?
No, I haven't noticed any swelling in my legs or around my eyes.
Have you had any recent infections or fever?
No, I haven't had any recent infections or fever.
Do you have any past medical history of kidney disease or any other chronic illnesses?
I was diagnosed with latent tuberculosis six years ago, but no history of kidney disease or other chronic illnesses.
Are you currently taking any medications, including over-the-counter drugs or supplements?
No, I am not taking any medications.
Do you have any family history of kidney disease or autoimmune disorders?
My maternal aunt has systemic lupus erythematosus, but no known family history of kidney disease.
Final Diagnosis: Goodpasture syndrome.
